title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message:
820-00165 green orange light, no fan, no boot
at first it did not turn on with battery, so I changed the smc but since no more starting
no short, no liquid damage

PP5V_S5 5v
pp3v42_G3H 3,42v
ppbus_g3h 8,6v
p3v3_s5 3,3v

PP3V3_S4SW_SNS 0v
SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN 0v
pm_pwrbtn_l 3,42v

I changed several times smc but same result

title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message:
Don't change components without reason.
Put logic in the repair process.

Do you get 3V3_SUS?
If yes, trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L (at same time).

title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message:
3V3_SUS 3,3v
 PM_PWRBTN_L 3,42 constant.
 when I trigger SMC_ONOFF_L, PM_PWRBTN_L = 0,35v

title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message:
Does it come back to 3V, when release SMC_ONOFF_L?

Check for pulse at PM_SLP_S4_L, at same time.

title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message:
yes come back
PM_SLP_S4_L 0v

title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message:
No pulse at all at PM_SLP_S4_L?
Remember to check it at same time when trigger SMC_ONOFF_L.

title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message: no pulse  even with   SMC_ONOFF_L,  PM_SLP_S4_L  stay at 0V

title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message:
Then you have a PCH related problem.
Check first its basic requirments; PM_DSW_PWRGD, PCH_DSWVRMEN, PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN and the 4 RTC (DC) signals.

title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message:
PM_DSW_PWRGD 3,42v
PCH_DSWVRMEN 3,16v
PM_BATLOW_L  0v
SMC_ADAPTER_EN  3,42v
RTC_RESET_L 3,31v
PPVRTC_G3H 3,32V
PP3V42_G3H 3,42
PP3V3_S5RS3RS0_SYSCLKGEN 3,32v
PP1V2_CAM_XTALPCIEVDD 0v
PP3V3_TBTLC 0v
SYSCLK_CLK25M_X2_R 0v
SYSCLK_CLK25M_X1 0,32v
PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1 0,48v

title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message:
"PM_BATLOW_L  0v"
PCH can't start power on sequence then.
Are you using original Magsafe 2 charger?

BTW, apart of RTC_RESET_L, I don't see other RTC DC signal listed.
Are not there 3 other lines EXACTLY near it on the same PCH RTC block?
I didn't ask for power, nor RTC clock.

title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message:
PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1 0,43
SYSCLK_CLK25M_CAMERA 0v
SYSCLK_CLK25M_TBT 0v
PCH_INTRUDER_L 2,90v
PCH_INTVRMEN 3,20v

yes with original charger, same with other charger same result, can you give me the signals you need? Sorry I'm still harmful compared to you

when I took the voltage on PCH_INTVRMEN, the motherboad turned and the fan turned hard and the processor heated normally, it's like I had woken it up I think maybe I touched RTC_RESET_L at the same time without do it on purpose between r1302 and r1303

I took the charger out and put it back in but it won't start.

sorry for my English I am French

title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message: You've posted two RTC signals more, but I still don't see PCH_SRTCRST_L.

title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message: Sorry,  PCH_SRTCRST_L  3,31v

title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message:
PM_RSMRST_L steady high?

Check if starts in SMC bypass mode.

title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message:
PM_RSMRST_L  3,28 stable
smc bypass no effect

title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message:
Check if reacts again when touch any RTC signals with multimeter.

Reflow SMC, in case of bad solders.

title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message: I still managed to make it start by touching PM_RSMRST_L with the multimeter, I already changed three smc for the same result  : s

title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message:
Still 0V on PM_BATLOW_L?
If yes, check R1410.

title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message:
oui PM_BATLOW_L 0v, R1410 dessoudé 10kohms, R1410 soudé 2,5kohms
R1410 pin 1 : 3,3, pin 2 : 0v, the resistor alone is 10k, but 2k when soldered, mode diod pin 2:  2,2 it's a short?

title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message: i removed smc, r1410 came back to 10k and no shorts, smc was bad then, or badly soldered?

title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message:
"mode diod pin 2:  2,2 it's a short?"
PLEASE, post accurate information!
2.200 in diode mode (to ground), or what?
002.2 is short...

Be aware, resistors value measured onboard can differ a lot in respect of nominal value.
Other components create parasitic resistors, which change the expected reading.

title: Macbook air A1466 no power
message: I replaced the smc everything works again thanks for the help
